lead_paragraph: Mr. Rusbridger, lauded as one of the finest journalists of his generation, gave up a plum role at the organization’s parent after a falling out with its new leaders.

byline.contributor: Graham Bowley contributed reporting from Toronto, Sarah Lyall from New York, and Nicola Clark from Paris.
byline.original: By PRASHANT S. RAO and SEWELL CHAN

headline.print_headline: Heralded British News Outlet Loses a Once and Future Leader
headline.main: Alan Rusbridger, Once Guardian’s Celebrated Editor, Severs Ties With It

snippet: Mr. Rusbridger, lauded as one of the finest journalists of his generation, gave up a plum role at the organization’s parent after a falling out with its new leaders.
abstract: Former Guardian editor Alan Rusbridger, who guided paper to international prominence and was poised to become chairman of Scott Trust, nonprofit organization that owns it, abruptly resigns; cites internal tensions exacerbated by ongoing instability in media industry.
